definition: to proclaim/to make public or well known
surname Xuan
to declare (publicly)/to announce
abbr. for 揚州|扬州[Yang2 zhou1]/surname Yang
to raise/to hoist/the action of tossing or winnowing/scattering (in the wind)/to flutter/to propagate

sentences.english: All it's doing is hyping everyone up.
sentences.chinese: “所有它的做法是每個人都大肆宣揚了”。

sentences.english: The book was quickly brandished by the left as vindication of social democracy.
sentences.chinese: 左翼分子聞風而動，攻擊該書宣揚社會民主主義。

sentences.english: Another  fallacy promoted by sales reps.
sentences.chinese: 又是一個銷售代表宣揚的謬論。

sentences.english: Alleged sorcery by fox demons occasionally caused collective panics.
sentences.chinese: 宣揚狐妖巫術偶爾會引發羣體的恐慌。

sentences.english: The Chinese went into a well-publicized huff, almost ruining the Sino- Nipponese summit.
sentences.chinese: 中國人極力宣揚其憤怒，幾乎將中日會晤毀於一旦。

sentences.english: He was arrested by Los Angeles police and the media made a fuss of it. I really feel sorry for him.
sentences.chinese: 洛山磯的警察逮捕了他，新聞界大肆宣揚。

sentences.english: We must publicize the meeting widely.
sentences.chinese: 我們必須廣泛地宣揚這次會議。

sentences.english: I have no need to advertise my fears or my insecurities.
sentences.chinese: 我不需要大肆宣揚我害怕或者缺乏安全感。

sentences.english: He was arrested by Los Angeles police and the media made a fuss of it.
sentences.chinese: 洛山磯的警察逮捕了他，新聞界大肆宣揚。

sentences.english: This defect propagates to all products in a particular batch until the design is changed to the right one.
sentences.chinese: 這一缺陷宣揚所有產品設計直到某一批改爲正確的。

sentences.english: This is how they came to reclaim their humanity.
sentences.chinese: 這就是他們如何宣揚他們的人性。

sentences.english: However, it does not require universities to promote ignorance.
sentences.chinese: 但是，憲法並未要求大學就該宣揚愚昧。

sentences.english: Be cautious if the clproposes for the product seem exaggeringestedd or unrewoulsistic.
sentences.chinese: 假如產品宣揚看起來夸誕或是失真，請小心。

sentences.english: What's more, wrote books to advocate the western culture.
sentences.chinese: 此外，他還著書立說，積極宣揚西方文化。

sentences.english: She blazed her discovery abroad everywhere.

definition: to disseminate/to propagate/to spread
to transmit/to pass on to sb else/(math.) transitive
Volkswagen (automobile manufacturer)
the masses/the great bulk of the population/popular (of music, science etc)
to extend/to spread/to popularize/generalization/promotion (of a product etc)
to develop/to make full use of
to approve of/to endorse/to acknowledge/to recognize/to identify oneself with
society/CL:個|个[ge4]
to love one's country/patriotic
to encourage
to pass on/to convey/to relay/to transmit/transmission
so-called/what is called
they
(of an area) vast or extensive/large-scale/widespread/(of people) numerous
group/organization/team/CL:個|个[ge4]
to make a supreme effort/at all costs
to practice/to put into practice
